resources.string:
Arnold Trost at your service.

I used to be the sailing master on the Vernal Bounty, keeping watch against storms.

The storms here are unnatural things.

These days, I find it is better to stay indoors.

Don't you listen to Rosina Bryce.

The rumors she collects aren't worth the time she spends collecting them.

They've led more than one person off on fool's errands.
Rosina won't leave things well enough alone.\n\nI didn't want to tell her anything, but she goes poking around anyway.
I've put the coin in a place where no one can find it.\n\nPerhaps that'll break the cycle and its bad luck won't spread.
That coin is nothing but bad luck, and you helped spread it!\n\nI don't know what you are up to around here, but I recommend you do it elsewhere.

You're a new face in town!

I'm Rosina Bryce

I used to be the coxwain on pirate vessel the Fair Weather Friend.

You could say I know a thing or two about enduring hostile environments.

Heard anything interesting lately?

You've got to listen to all the rumors and know which are true to be a successful pirate.

It's how you find your next big score, or who to avoid.

So, now Trost wants you to recover the Touched Coin.

Benjamin is a nasty piece of work.

If he has the luck of the coin, it won't go well for you.
Ha! I told Trost once that anything the Vernal Bounty had, the Fair Weather Friend would one day own!\n\nThanks for proving me true to my word.
Impressive, I wasn't sure you could take on Benjamin.\n\nNot many can survive his wrath.

Welcome to Cutlass Keys.

I am Antonia Cassia Lucian, the captain of this settlement.

I used to be captain of the pirate ship Last Watch before becoming trapped on Aeternum.
Ever since Shattered Mountain erupted, it feels like the Corrupted are breathing down our necks.\n\nEven Cutlass Keys has been blighted by their presence.
A solid night’s sleep is one thing.\n\nBut I'm worried that the strange interest the Corrupted are showing is spreading.
With the return of the fort's plans, we can finally update all our defenses.\n\nI have a feeling we'll need them in the days ahead.
You've been a great help disrupting the Corrupted in Cutlass Keys.\n\nYou'll always be welcome as a member of our crew.
You know, I was thinking, my days of swashbuckling are few and far between lately.\n\nI've been sitting on an idea for a sword sharp enough to slice a stone block. That something you'd care for?
Seeing that blade strapped to your belt brings me great pride, {playerName}.\n\nIf ever there were a fighter worthy to wield the "Keen Temper", I'm looking right at them.

Welcome! I'm Lixin Fei, ship's carpenter by trade.

I like to keep up on all the latest crafting advancements.

Let me know if you need anything made special.

You've really helped the captain out.

I've seen those fuses you brought back.

I wouldn't have thought the Corrupted were clever enough to make them.
I'm really thankful for those samples you brought.\n\nIt's been very interesting studying them.
Those lightning bombs are sure to help hold off the Corrupted the next time they try to take over our fort!
Antonia has me working on more applications of those lightning spirits.\n\nWe could always use more defenses against the Corrupted.
Winifred Silas, Commander of the Marauders.\n\nThis is a harsh place, and you have to be tenacious to survive.
You must fight to survive here.\n\nThere are frequent attacks from the Corrupted and a never-ending supply of pirates out to steal our supplies.

You must fight to survive here.

There are frequent attacks from the Corrupted and a never-ending supply of pirates out to steal our supplies.

[ Level 24 required for Cutlass Keys faction missions ]
You only have the leisure to study because we Marauders spill our blood.
You cultists always seem scarce when the Corrupted are at our gates.

You don't look so tough. You've built quite a reputation for yourself, but you don't deserve it. \n\nNow you're supposedly ready to advance, but I don't buy it. There's no way you could pass the trial.

You don't look so tough. You've built quite a reputation for yourself, but you don't deserve it. 

Now you're supposedly ready to advance, but I don't buy it. There's no way you could pass the trial.

[ Level 20 required for the "Trial of the Gladiator" Quest ]
No way. I don't blastin' believe it! I just lost quite a bit of azoth on that bet.\n\nYou've earned your new rank, but we both know you don't deserve it!

No way. I don't blastin' believe it! I just lost quite a bit of azoth on that bet.

You've earned your new rank, but we both know you don't deserve it!

[ Level 24 required for Cutlass Keys faction missions ]
Ah, hello there. Tragic what happened to Silas, isn't it?\n\nI'm just kidding - let's face it - she was a horrible person. You did us all a favor putting that one down.

Ah, hello there. Tragic what happened to Silas, isn't it?

I'm just kidding - let's face it - she was a horrible person. You did us all a favor putting that one down.

[ Level 24 required for Cutlass Keys faction missions ]
Ah, I am Alchemist Edwarde Geoff.\n\nThe legacy of the Ancients has never been closer, but only we of the Syndicate are positioned to take it in our grasp.
I have been studying the ruins and am working to harness the power of Azoth within them. Perhaps you will help.
I have been studying the ruins and am working to harness the power of Azoth within them. Perhaps you will help.\n\n[ Level 24 required for Cutlass Keys faction missions ]
You profiteers let your greed for gold distract you from the real fortune of Aeturnum.
I'll grant that you acolytes live a noble life. Ignorant and blind, perhaps pointless, even. Yet noble.
Be warned, freelancer. I, Adjudicator Robert Strong, do not speak lightly.\n\nThis place is filled with former pirates poised on the edge of becoming Lost.
Much of the suffering in this settlement is brought on by the foolish actions of those who settled here.\n\nStill, we must aid them despite their past poor choices.

Much of the suffering in this settlement is brought on by the foolish actions of those who settled here.

Still, we must aid them despite their past poor choices.

[ Level 24 required for Cutlass Keys faction missions ]
You have so much more inside than you know, Marauder. Perhaps one day, you will cast off that foul title and join the light.
A curious bunch, you erudites. The pursuit of secular knowledge just creates more questions. The only answer is within the nature of belief itself.

Shillie Duffy here, the quartermaster of this settlement.

Most of us served on different pirate ships before we ended up in this place.

Now we've banded together as a new crew.
No one is going to recognize this as a pirate settlement without any plunder.\n\nGold! Silks! Overflowing chests of bursting with purloined merchandise!
The settlement is starting to prosper, thanks to your hard work.\n\nIf only more members of Cutlass Keys were as useful we'd have an affluent city in no time.
I should have listened when Swampy first mentioned supplies were missing.\n\nI've been blind. I kept thinking it was the Corrupted, when in truth it was my old crew.
Ha! Those Wormsworn pirates won't recover from the blow you dealt them!\n\nYou know, I've heard of something that might be useful, in case they ever come back.
Plundering that armor was a mighty feat. Now you're a true pirate, not just in looks, but in deeds.\n\nMake no mistake, there'll be tales about you someday, just you wait.

Hi, I'm Plute Swampy! I used to be the cook aboard the Salty Albatross.

Ah, those were the days!

We might not have been the best pirate ship, but we had the most fun.

What'll it be?

A drink to keep the horrors of the Corrupted at bay?

Or a hearty meal to reassure yourself you aren't Lost?
I tell you, it's a relief to have my pots and pans back.\n\nThey were seasoned to perfection from years upon the sea.
Thirsty for a tankard of Bitter Squall?\n\nNow that I have my recipes and pots back, it will be easy to mix up for you.
It does my heart good to see what you've been up to around here.\n\nStop by anytime if you'd like a Sea Dog special as my way of saying thanks.
Yes? You may remember me, I'm William Heron. I've been poking through the ruins nearby.
You look like you could use a rest.\n\nI'm Reginald Batty, and this is my inn, the Steadfast Arms.
Come to fish in Cutlass Keys, have you?\n\nI'm Master Fisher Edith Perchal, and you won't find better waters for fishing in all of Aeternum.
Did I tell you about the one that got away?\n\nI swear, that fish was bigger than some of the wrecks you'll find around here! And would've been useful for Alchemy, too!
Still fishing up the big ones? Good on you.\n\nThose fish won't catch themselves!
The animals on Aeternum are magnificent! Such power, such strength! \n\nOh, I'm Tosch the Tamer, and I'm certain there is a trick to taming the animals on Aeternum.

Have you noticed how all the animals that come to Aeternum seem to go wild? Even those that had been tamed? \n\n I've been studying the animals in Cutlass Keys for quite a while now, and I think I know how to tame them again!
While you were away, I remembered there’s another beast here in Cutlass Keys that, to think of taming it, well, it could make me one of the most famous people on Aeternum.
Sadly, this means the alligators are far too dangerous to tame. But the wildcats looked promising. \n\nWhile I study Snaggletooth’s tooth, I need more materials from other felines in the area.
So I've been thinking. There is one group on Aeternum that seem to have mastered taming animals. \n\nOne group who has the element we are missing!
Now that I know the secret of taming, there is one thing left to do.
Ah, isn't a boar just the perfect pet? It eats almost anything. And if it reverts to being wild, well, you've got yourself a meal!
Want to find your way around the swamp? You can't go wrong by talking to me, Swamp Walker Nekumanesh, fresh back from Restless Shores.
I never thought I'd say this, but it's just too quiet around here, you know? \n\nIt reminds me of my time in Restless Shores when I befriended an alligator. Here though, I feel so alone.
Since Jocelyn wasn’t at the colony, I have another idea of where she might’ve gone to. \n\nShe had some relatives in the area she might be visiting who were always ready to lend a sympathetic ear.
I've been mapping where you found all those teeth, and I think I know where my wife is. \n\nThe trail leads deep into the swamp, deeper than I'd expect Jocelyn to go, given how much she hated my job.

Ah Jocelyn, where did we go wrong? At least I have her lengthy diary to remember her by. It will take me a lifetime to read it all! \n\nI won’t have time to visit Restless Shores. I wonder how my alligator friend is doing?
I'm Watcher Jie Hu. What do I watch? Not much, anymore. My watching days are over.
So, you have found me, it was bound to happen sometime. \n\nI no longer have my bells, if you have come to hear them ring.

You've got a youthful spring in your step, and seem to have energy to spare, not like me. \n\nI'd appreciate it if you could check on one more bridge for me. It's been a while and I'd like to know how it is holding up.

Bridges are the lifelines of Cutlass Keys. You can't move goods without stable bridges to get them there. \n\nWhen a bridge is overrun, that community becomes isolated. And bad things happen when you are alone on Aeternum.
There are other bridges I spent time patrolling in Cutlass Keys. \n\nBridges located in places far more dangerous than the salt marshes. I don't like to think about those bridges much, anymore.

In the past, I did some things I am not proud of. Things I long to forget. \n\nThose pirates, you spend enough time fighting them and you start to learn their tactics, start to think like them, start to become them.
Thank you. My bells are gone, but the truth of my actions finally rings free. \n\nI am no longer chained to my past actions.

Hi, hi there! I'm Claire, Claire Fergus. And I'm going to be a treasure hunter! I've read all about it! \n\nThat's why I'm in Cutlass Keys! This place is filled with pirate treasure, you just have to know how to find it.

Hello again! I have it on good authority that there is real pirate treasure nearby! I know it’s nearby, because I've got this map. Isn’t that exciting? \n\nYou know, I could use a partner to help me search, what do you say?

Ooo! I'm so mad! I can't believe Mister Broadbin cheated me out of my half of the treasure! Our half! \n\nI should have seen it. That old sailor didn’t just want to find pirate treasure, he wanted to be a pirate!

We're both real treasure hunters now! Have you been enjoying your spoils? I still can’t decide where to live. \n\nI’ve heard about pirate treasure in Reekwater. But I feel I haven’t uncovered all I can in Cutlass Keys.
Hello there, I'm Billiam Rowen, though most call me Wistful Bill. \n\nThey're not wrong, mind you. I long for the days when I used to be at sea.

As long as you're traveling about, I could use your help. You might have come across my old ship in your travels. \n\nAh, she was a fine thing in her day. Not too seaworthy anymore, though. We called her The Storm Petral.

There’s nothing I can't chart with my sextant. Though, it wasn't the only device I needed for my job. \n\nI had a wonderful mariner's astrolabe, the finest you ever did see. My grandad had used it, back when he sailed.

It’s my old sea charts. Over twenty years of work went into those, before I ever reached the shores of this cursed island. \n\nAnd once I landed, well, I kept them around, to remind me of the past. Until they were stolen!
I may not be sailing over the ocean anymore, but I can still chart the tides and stars like I used to. \n\nStrang thing, that. I'd swear this island moves about.
I am Decima Opimius, baker extraordinaire. \n\nI do not share my trade secrets with just anyone, you understand.
That Swampy, always winning the annual Cutlass Keys cook-off. \n\nIt is a tragedy to those of us with refined tastes!
Thanks to your help, the name Opimius shall once again ring out as the best among bakers.
